com.snap2d.gl.opengl

Interface GLRenderable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    RenderableSpi
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Ball, Entity, EntityManager, GenericEntity, NiftyRenderable, Paddle, PlayerEntity

    public interface GLRenderable
extends RenderableSpi
    Rendering interface for the Snap2D OpenGL pipeline. Any Object that should be drawn or updated per frame/tick must implement this interface and register with an active #GLRenderControl.
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dispose(GLHandle handle)
      Called when the current GL rendering context is being destroyed.
      void init(GLHandle handle)
      Called during initialization and/or recreation of the current rendering environment.
      void render(GLHandle handle, float interpolation)
      Called on each frame by the rendering engine.
      void resize(GLHandle handle, int wt, int ht)
      Called when the OpenGL context invoking the GLRenderable has been resized, allowing the GLRenderable object to perform necessary scaling.
      void update(long nanoTimeNow, long nanoTimeLast)
      Called on each tick of the game loop.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(GLHandle handle)
        Called during initialization and/or recreation of the current rendering environment. This method will be called as soon as a GLRenderControl has added the GLRenderable to its rendering queue.
        Parameters:
        handle -

      • dispose

        void dispose(GLHandle handle)
        Called when the current GL rendering context is being destroyed. GLRenderable implementations should release any resources held both in and out of the OpenGL system.
        Parameters:
        handle -

      • render

        void render(GLHandle handle,
          float interpolation)
        Called on each frame by the rendering engine. The receiving GLRenderable can use the GLHandle to draw to the GL context.
        Parameters:
        handle -
        interpolation -

      • update

        void update(long nanoTimeNow,
          long nanoTimeLast)
        Called on each tick of the game loop. This method is where logic and position updates should take place.
        Specified by:
        update in interface RenderableSpi
        Parameters:
        nanoTimeNow - the fixed nano time at the start of the update cycle
        nanoTimeLast - the fixed nano time of the last update

      • resize

        void resize(GLHandle handle,
          int wt,
          int ht)
        Called when the OpenGL context invoking the GLRenderable has been resized, allowing the GLRenderable object to perform necessary scaling. This method will be called after the init(GLHandle) method if and only if the GLRenderControl is being displayed in a valid window upon the GLRenderable being added to a rendering queue.
        Parameters:
        the - GLHandle to the GL context
        wt - the total width of the current rendering context in screen space
        ht - the total height of the current rendering context in screen space
